item.name: 1000 and One Treasures
item.comment: Elegant and interesting kids game!

item.name: 18AL
item.comment:
My first game of 18xx series, so I'll be gently with my rating.
Making money with companies is always fun, so overall I liked the economical aspects. There's ton of excessive 'baggage' (in my mind) even in this 18xx version which should be gently for newcomers. I wouldn't mind to play a game with less baggage and more streamlined. There must be way to make this clearer, more elegant, more streamlined, withouth losing the main core? I mean running a Excel-calculation at the end of the game is just dumn, isn't it?
But I'm not really sure do 18xx fans really want any streamlining. Let me take an example: evaluating the track building (where to build your track, what company has the best prospects etc) is really hard for a newbie. Yet I suspect that not all of the 18xx players would want to make this too clear, as learning to read the obscurdities of the map is part of the process? I have understood listening what others talk that part of the fun is to learn all the tricks and to get better (beat the newbies).
Well, despite all this, I was actually able to win my first game! OK, I got a bit support in some tough spots from the others (more experienced) players, but still :)

item.name: 1960: The Making of the President
item.comment: Quite fast gameplay - although there are some details to remember. The historical theme is nice. However, withouth the baggage the design might be more elegant and interesting... :p

item.name: 2 de Mayo
item.comment: Cool cat and mouse game. I dislike the action cards though. Also, there are quite many rules and exceptions to remember. I understand that this all because of the theme, but as an Eurogamer, I don't find that too engaging... :)

item.name: 20th Century
item.comment: A bidding game, which some simple empire building aspects. I liked the carcassonne stylish tile building of your empire. The bidding seemed to be bit heavy mechanic for the game though. With the 5 players, the game was way too long for what it offered. Some good, some bad, but decent overall.
Simple game, very much along the lines of No Thanks. Not bad.

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment: I like it. Quite fast and easy. I don't expect this to have a lot of depth and the scoring is bit too involved for such a short game, but there are plenty of good things in the game too.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Leaders
item.comment: I liked it. Expands the playability, withouth lengthening the playtime too much. Probably will not bother with additional expansions though. 7 wonders while nice, does not excite that much anymore after 15 games.

item.name: Ab in die Tonne
item.comment: Not a bad dexterity game. I like the card playing. The piling might start to feel too samey after a while... but still quite nice!

item.name: Acquire
item.comment: Not bad for such an old game! Economic game with some interesting and clever mechanics. My biggest complaint is importance and need to track the number of stocks of different players, which can be tedious.

item.name: Advanced Civilization
item.comment:
Now THIS is Difficult to rate.
Old school game, but still after all the years it is surpisingly playable. I like some of the mechanics and other concepts, e.g. how to accuire goods and the trading. But of course it takes way too long time to play it and some parts are quite teadious.
Although there is too much downtime in moving, resolving calamities, calculating discounts to techs etc, I still like the structure and rhytm of the game. The involved and loud trading parts really juice up the game.

item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
item.comment: This game has some interesting elements, but I didn't find too interesting as a whole. The genre is difficult.

item.name: Afrikan tähti
item.comment: It's quite decent children's game, if you play with some rule changes. We play so that if you get a robber, you only lose 100 pound... works that way much better! :)

item.name: Age of Industry
item.comment:
Initial rating after one play.
Quite abstract and non-intuitive rule set. Most probaly offers nice mental challenges for those who like games like that. I was positively surprised of relatively fast moving game play. Also, the amount of rules in the game was less than I was expecting (which is a good thing).

item.name: Agricola
item.comment:
Only family game played so far. I like it, but the game can be a little bit too slow with many players (for an ap-group at least).
update: full game now. Still good.

item.name: Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small
item.comment:
Mechanics very similar to Agricola --> good thing because it is easy to teach and learn (for people who know Agricola already). Simple game play and setup are definitely a big positive for me here.
I'm quite concerned about the replayability though (after one play). As there are no random elements in the game, I am afraid the game could start to feel very much the same-y. I usually prefer games that force you to adapt as they make each game feel different - in ACBaS there is very little of this happening.

item.name: Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small – Even More Buildings Big and Small
Agricola: Farmers of the Moor
item.comment: A good addition to a great game. Adds little bit more complexity and some more agony.

item.name: Airlines Europe
item.comment: Felt a bit underdeveloped (too long and fiddly) after one play. Some spirit, elegance and cuthroatness seemed to be lacking, compared to say Chicago Express.

item.name: Alien Frontiers
item.comment: Some nice ideas but overly long. Also some aspects of the game just didn't fit to my taste. I don't like the stealing aspect too much for example. Also, I'm quite worried about some aspects of the game - I think design-wise it was bad idea to limit the dices that can be placed in the action space that lets you place influence disks on the planet. In the game it feels that every turn was evolving around that action: can I get three grey cubes and take the action that allows me place the influence disks or not. If I could do it, my turn was over in few minutes, but if it was impossible the turn would take much longer...

item.name: Alliances
item.comment: Felt strange for me and not in a good way!

item.name: Among the Stars
item.comment: Among the Stars shares mechanically many elements with 7 Wonders - yet lacks many of the interesting elements 7 Wonders has. Unfortunately, this game didn't do too much for me.

item.name: Android: Netrunner
item.comment: Very preliminary thoughts after one introductory play: I really enjoyed the theme and it is well implemented. Asymmetry is cool too. I'm undecided about the mechanics atm. They felt ok, but didn't excite that much. For example, somehow the 4 actions round sturcture didn't put my pants on fire... But we'll see after few plays how it turns out!

item.name: Animal Upon Animal
item.comment: Really fun dexterity game!

item.name: Antike
item.comment:
Dissapointing. The rondel seemed to me quite disconnected from the whole civilization experience. I think it works better in normal resource optimation game.
The non-luck compact maybe wasn't the best option here as it really isn't elegant and simple enough.
I wasn't found on the scoring system as well.
Also, the game felt a bit scripted already on the first play.
The genre is tough, yet interesting.

item.name: Apples to Apples
item.comment: A "game" that is relatively fun to play with the right group of people (not too serious gamers).

item.name: Arcanum
item.comment: This was a bit more unusual than most euro-games - a definitive plus! Despite that, it didn't felt that exciting to me, unfortunately.

item.name: Ascending Empires
item.comment:
The game felt a bit scripted, especially in the start. I'm slightly worried how much there really is interestig replayability here.
I liked the flicking aspect, but I thought that there maybe was a bit too much everything else in the game (which wasn't particulary interesting to me).

item.name: Ascension: Deckbuilding Game
item.comment:
I have played the IPad version. I think it is better than I thought so far, but I have to play some more to rate it.
edit: OK. I think it is 6. I'm not that convinced that there is a lot of strategy in this game. the IPad app is suberb though!

item.name: At the Gates of Loyang
item.comment: Puzzly game with very low interaction (and most of the interaction anyhow is quite non-interesting). I enjoyed it quite a bit anyway.

item.name: Attika
item.comment: My wife likes this game a lot. I think it is quite good, but not my favorite still.

item.name: Auf Achse
item.comment: Nothing special here. Not bad either.

item.name: Augustus
item.comment: Fast, semi-simple family game, with exciting bingo mechanics :)

item.name: Ave Caesar
item.comment: A fast moving racing game.

item.name: BANG!
item.comment: This game was fun for the first few games. After that it has been just more or less suffering. It is very chaotic and luck dependent and there is nothing more frustrating than play a game with 5-7 players, for ~1 hour, and dying in the very beginning - without a change to play ANY cards at all!

item.name: Battle Line
item.comment:
Tense but fun game.
We play this without the special cards (then BL=Schotten Totten, basically). Better in this way I think.

item.name: Battle Sheep
item.comment: Quite nice light little abstract.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica
item.comment: Not very elegant and too long, but it captures the athmosphere of the TV-series amazingly well.

item.name: Bausack
item.comment: Pretty fun dexterity game!

item.name: Bezzerwizzer
item.comment: It's better than Trivial Pursuit for sure, but I wasn't too wild about the extra features such as Zwap and Bezzerwisser tiles. They create complexity and AP for almost zero gain in the gameplay.

item.name: Biberbau & Co.
item.comment: Super simple kids game with push your luck dynamics. Not bad, though not that many interesting choices in this game

item.name: Biblios
item.comment:
What a great filler! I especially love the 2 player game.
update: after 43 plays, I have updated the rating from 9 to 10. This is simply a brilliant game.

item.name: Big Points
item.comment: Not bad: very minimalistic, fast, easy and somewhat fun.

item.name: Black Spy
item.comment: Probably my favorite trick-taking game. Very simple, yet interesting.

item.name: Blokus
item.comment: I wasn't very sold on this after one play. OK, it is easy to learn which is always a good thing. I guess I have to play it again too se do I really like it or not.

item.name: Blokus 3D
item.comment: Quite fun and easy to learn. Fast 3D game experience.

item.name: The Blue Lion
item.comment: Easy rules, a bit brain-burning game with a strong memory element.

item.name: Blue Moon
item.comment: Very fun and addictive! Fast and nice feeling when playing.

item.name: Blue Moon: The Aqua
item.comment: Very nice graphics! Seems little bit too powerful to me, however..

item.name: La Boca
item.comment: the basic idea is quite nice. However, with many players there is some down time as only 2 players can solve the puzzles at the same time. Also, it is a bit painful to move the box between the active players every time. Finally, I'm not sure how many plays the game holds, before starting to be repetitive.

item.name: The Bottle Imp
item.comment: Very good trick-taking game. I'm not too wild about the whole trick-taking concept in general, though..

item.name: BraveRats
item.comment: Super simple 2pl game.

item.name: Bruges
item.comment:
Ugh, I did not enjoy this at all. The decision tree seemed to be very wide (LOTS of different options each turn) yet it seemed somehow very uninteresting for me. Lots of unique cards, but with very limited number of them you actually played during a single game.
So: Mash of different things and mechanics, without a holistic feeling of a game. Not my cup of tea.
The drawings on the cards were beautiful though!

item.name: Bunny Bunny Moose Moose
item.comment: A positive suprise for me! I thought that I wouldn´t like this game at all, but I found it to be a hilarious experience! I would like to try it again after a few beers sometime... :)

item.name: Byzantio
item.comment:
The genre for this is super tough and it has some interesting elements. But I did not enjoyed this too much, I'm afraid. I think it has some problems and the dice (especially for the events) can have a major influence for the outcome of the game.
Also, for example, if two players chose most of the same regions (which is done hidden), that could be devastating for the game - i find this feature quite bad!

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$
item.comment: This can be veery fun game if you have the right group!

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: Yakuzas
item.comment: Some of the special cards were way too powerful. Also, being a Yakuza was kind of boring as you could only hack a guy that sits directly next to you. Shurikens were however fun :)

item.name: Campaign Manager 2008
item.comment:
Compered to the 1960 Making of the Presinden, I enjoyed more the fact that the game wasn't just 'zero sum play' - but in here you can do wrong moves and really lose the influence for good.
After first play, the key demographic felt way too weak and uninteresting. I'm all a bit worried about the replaybility of the game as the seemed to be quite symmetric and cards did only few (interesting) things.
A minor complaint is also that, after you have won your state, you must choose which state to play next. I would have preferred just a random draw or something more elegant. The current system just slows the game down and I just didn't felt any joy going through the state deck and decide which one to pick.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Castle
item.comment:
I'm not a big fan of the Carcassonne series. However, this game felt little better than the basic game.
Nevertheless, I think that there is just too many possibilites in this game. Because of this, it feels to me that there is no real tension in the game. This might be because it is hard to see what would be a "good" move (or the best).
Maybe this is just my stupidity or inexprerience - don't know yet.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Discovery
item.comment: The game play was interesting enough. The downside (after first play anyway) seem to a big luck of the draw. Also the game felt too slow and long. Let's see if we get to play it faster...

item.name: Cards Against Humanity
item.comment: Quite fun (but rough) party game.

item.name: Cartagena
item.comment: Best with three. Very good family game that can be played withouth doing too much thinking... but there are suprisingly much to think if you want to - even withouth any variants. I have a quite good winning percentage... ;)

item.name: Cartagena 2. The Pirate's Nest
item.comment: Cartagena is really great game, but I don't see any reason why this one should exist. I don't like the new very small changes.

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy
item.comment: Mostly cool meaty game. Takes a bit longish, but the choices are interesting.

item.name: Catan
item.comment: A very good game, just too much luck involved. Nowdays, I am totally tired of this game, but heck, I have played ~50 games and got certainly my fun out of it!

item.name: Catan Dice Game
item.comment: Truly a multiplayer solitaire. Also, I don't see too much point playing this, if you are not familiar with the real Catan game. But with these disclaimers, it's not that bad :)

item.name: Caverna: The Cave Farmers
item.comment: Hard to rate as I see it so close to Agricola. I like some of the changes, but for example the Adventuring felt quite disconnected from the rest of the game. Crazy setup time and fixed buildings don't get me too excited. But of course it is a solid game that I'm happy to play again.

item.name: Caylus
item.comment:
Too long and dry game for me!
It took something like 6-7 hours in our first play (+including rules explanations) with 5 noobies!! That is just too much!

item.name: Celebrities
item.comment: Very nice! The main concept is excellent.

item.name: Celtica
item.comment: Didn't like this one too much - there were almost no interesting decisions in the game to make...

item.name: Central Market
item.comment: Some nice concepts here! I really liked the kg-limits for placing the goods. However, at the same time I felt that something was missing. I might be wrong, but perhaps increasing the average number of cards in your hand would bring more strategy to the game?

item.name: Chaos in the Old World
item.comment: Not bad, but not terribly interesting either. Asymmetry is interesting, but it takes some time to get to now all the cards and special powers. The core rules are quite easy and clear which is definite plus!

item.name: Charly
item.comment: Nice little game about feeding animals. Nothing too special here, but the gameplay was fast, fun and intuitive.

item.name: Chicago Express
item.comment: Game = 8, graphical representation = -0.5 -> 8-0.5=7.5

item.name: Choco
item.comment: Pretty ok game for young kids.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: Too random and long for my tastes (even when you play only to seven buildings). There are some nice elements, but not enough to really want me to play this.

item.name: Cities
item.comment: Nice little puzzle game.

item.name: The City
item.comment:
Super light Race for the Galaxy. I just wish they had done it solely with symbols, like in Race... I think I won't buy it until there is an English version out there (but then yes).
So it was overall pretty good for such a fast and light game. My concerns? I suspect there is not very much depth or replayability in the game. In addition, there was a lot of counting of symbols each turn and you had to write your points each turn (or use some chits) which all was a bit teadious for such a light game. Also, the exponential growth is suprisingly fast - maybe it blows up even a bit too fast? Anyways, I am happy to play it again and see how it holds up in continuous plays.

item.name: Clash of Cultures
item.comment: Very beautiful production, but otherwise disappointing :(

item.name: Coloretto
item.comment: Very nice short game! Addictive. Works best with not too serious gamers.

item.name: Colossal Arena
item.comment: Nice gard game with a cool betting mechanic. Fun to play.

item.name: Concept
item.comment: The concept of the Concept is brilliant! My first play of it was not too fun though, but it might be because of the strange group we had. I definitely want to play it again if it will work better or not (and then change my rating either to 6 or 8). My biggest fear is that if the guessing is too difficult, the game can stall badly.

item.name: Coney Island
item.comment: Initial impressions after one play: Simplicity was a plus, but the gameplay felt shallow and scripted to me. Yet there was lot of downtime :(

item.name: Conflict of Heroes: Awakening the Bear! – Russia 1941-42
item.comment: Action point system was fresh. Actually destroying an opponent's troop seemed to be quite hard and this fact might make the game play quite long. I have to try again to say my final verdict. But after my first play it would be: OK, but not great...

item.name: Confusion: Espionage and Deception in the Cold War
item.comment: Unique 2-player deduction game. Interesting.

item.name: Copié Collé
item.comment: Memory game, with qwirky but unfortunately not too interesting game play...

item.name: Coup
item.comment: Clever game with very few rules. I'm not sure how much depth there really is, but I'm interested to play some more to find out!

item.name: Court of the Medici
item.comment: I generally like 2p fast card games, but unfortunately did not find the game interesting at all.

item.name: Crokinole
item.comment: Really cool dexterity game! The fact that you only score the difference makes the game interesting to the very end.

item.name: Cubulus
item.comment: A real 3D game, which is a big plus! I was not convinced on the game play, if it is really interesting or not, after one play. But the initial impression was OK.

item.name: CV
item.comment: I love the theme of the game! Unfortunately, the game play was not that interesting. I felt it was quite random and reading/processing the symbols was somehow a bit too difficult for such a simple game --> can lead to slow game play and AP. I feel also that the theme was (mostly) pasted on - I think there would be more you could do with this theme...

item.name: Cyclades
item.comment:
Graphics and components are excellent.
Overall I liked the game. It is reasonably simple, quite fast and has nice aspects to it (light economic buildup + conflict).
However, winning the game is all about timing. Who will achieve the winning conditions can be a sum of clever and lucky incidents. I don't really care that much for this kind of endings. Also, I did not like how most of the cards worked.
But anyway, this is difficult genre for a game, yet very intriguing. Cyclades is quite nice package and I am happy to play it again.

item.name: Da ist der Wurm drin
item.comment:
Super simple children's game. Pure luck, but has fun Gimmick and seems to work OK with children. Not bad.
Edit: 6-->8 works like a charm! Even with our 2 years old.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
item.comment: Did not blow my mind but was decent for what it is.

item.name: Diamonds Club
item.comment: Nice! I especially like the coin placement system.

item.name: Dino-Alarm!
item.comment: Memory game (with few interesting twists) for kids.

item.name: Dixit
item.comment:
Nice family game.
edit: After 5 games, I'm quite worried about the replaybility. As the cards are always the same, you tend to get the same ideas each time especially with the same game group.

item.name: Dixit Jinx
item.comment: Very good, Dixit like but different. Simple rules, yet makes sense.

item.name: Dixit Odyssey
item.comment: Almost identical to regular dixit, just with different cards and guessing components.

item.name: Die Dolmengötter
item.comment: Initial rating. Interesting.

item.name: Dominion
item.comment:
Core idea is very original and interesting, I really appreciate the design.
After 30+ plays, I become quite bored with the game though. I very much dislike the setup. I find myself also not that interested to really study all the nuances with different setups. Instead I find myself using pretty much the same strategies from game to game (or if I try something "clever", I usually do badly).

item.name: Dominion: Intrigue
item.comment: Not bad, but makes the game quite long...

item.name: Dominion: Seaside
item.comment: Some nice cards yes, but otherwise same old, same old.

item.name: Drako
item.comment: Not bad what it is - fast, very easy and quite thematic 2 player game. There are quite a bit of hit, defend, hit, defend -type of repetitive actions which I fear might make it a bit dull after a while. But I think there are few ways to make some planning (in the future games).

item.name: Drum Roll
item.comment: Very beautiful game! The theme disappears quite fast and it is quite traditional cubey game, but OK anyways. However, I think the game lacked some tension. Especially the worker placement action selection mechanism was slow and did not add that much tension to the game. Maybe some other alternative would have worked better here?

item.name: Dungeon Lords
item.comment: Quite good! Lots of rules and fiddly as well, but I liked it a lot.

item.name: Dungeon Petz
item.comment:
I really liked Dungeon Lords, but there are just a bit too much rule details for my taste in that game. Dungeon Lords is a difficult game to get to the table because of this. Dungeon Petz is more straightforward game (you don't have anything like the combat phase in DL), but still filled with plenty of thematic details.
I thought the gameplay was good, but not as good as in the Dungeon Lords. But the streamlined rules are a definitive bonus. I really really like the Art and the athmosphere!

item.name: Dungeon Roll
item.comment: I really like the concept and components, but somehow the game play felt really uninteresting. The rules were very confusing... so there is a change we played something wrong too.

item.name: DungeonQuest
item.comment: Mechanically does not deserve a six - it really is an old game and super luck dependent! Yet somehow it still is compelling and intriguing! :)

item.name: The Dwarf King
item.comment: Not bad, but not anything special. Simplicity was a plus.

item.name: Eight-Minute Empire
item.comment: Cute little game! Easy to teach and play, yet offers some some meaningful choices.

item.name: Eketorp
item.comment: Light, chaotic simultaneous action selection game. Game can cause funny situations(+), but I did not find this too interesting to play.

item.name: Eminent Domain
item.comment:
Rating after one play.
Our game felt too long and we were pretty much fixed in our strategies (that felt like the best way to play for us). I didn't understand why there needed to be some much stuff in there: like many different goods, markers, different action cards etc... anyway, a lots of symbols that many didn't have that big impact on the game (or it felt that way).
Positive thing to me was that although it uses very similar mechanics to other games, it felt less similar to them than I thought it would.

item.name: En Garde
item.comment: I own the travel version of the game.

item.name: The Enchanted Tower
item.comment: I wasn't impressed. Graphics and components were super cool though, as always with this publisher.

item.name: Endeavor
item.comment: This great looking game was a small disapointment for me.

item.name: Epäillyt
item.comment: Nicely produced and smooth gameplay. Good job Kimmo! :)

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
item.comment: Unique game for sure. Don't know how interesting it really is for long run, but fun concept anyways :)

item.name: Eselsbrücke
item.comment:
The idea is intriguing and clever! Maybe even a bit too clever for a game that should be easy-to-play type family game...
We found that the it seemed to be more important to remember stories than to really tell good stories (which is a bit disappointing). There can be a lot of downtime, which really can be killer for a game like this. Left me with mixed feelings.

item.name: Evolution Earth: Cataclysm
item.comment:
Thoughts after one play. Note: the rules were quite hard to understand, so we might have played something wrong here.
Positive: theme is great and graphics are OK for a print and play game (although they are maybe little bit too dark overall).
Negative: the gameplay itself seemed to be unfortunately quite weak and unfinished. There was lot taken from Dominion, but most of the good part was left out and was replaced by something new that I didn't enjoy too much. The game is kind of deck building game, although the deck didn't improved that much during the game, actually it seemed to be the opposite...
Also, design-wise, I didn't quite got it why you could do only one action on your turn after you have tabled your resource cards? This almost completely destroyed the idea of deck building. For example, in Dominion you buy and use action cards and it is very important that your deck is in balanced between these two things. Making nice combos is the main part of the fun there.
In addition, I didn't like the shuffle card/mechanism. There were many times that you just draw 1-2 cards instead of 5 as the deck run out. Didn't like that at all. Why couldn't it be like in Dominion?
Also, the rule that player would lose, if he could do no action was brutal and seemed to be unneccessary (especially when combined with the fact that sometimes you only draw 1 card...)
I'm sorry to say, but I think this game should be improved quite a bit.
[i]update: the designer informed that the we played the shuffle card mechanics wrong and you should always draw 5 cards. Better this way, but won't change my opinion about the game in general.[/i]

item.name: Factory Fun
item.comment: First (and only) game was mind blowing... :P

item.name: Fauna
item.comment: Nice trivia game about animals. Clever mechanics, but I slightly am worried about the replayability - is the quizzing the same atributes over and over fun after many games? For me, it maybe feels a bit too same turn after turn. But anyway, the game has its place in my collection, I suppose.

item.name: Felix: The Cat in the Sack
Fettnapf
item.comment: Quite hilarious card game, but nothing too special get too wild about.

item.name: Finito!
item.comment: Super simple abstract puzzle game, not bad. No interaction, but that's no problem for me in this genre.

item.name: First Orchard
item.comment: Does well what it is supposed to do - the first 'game' for kids. Not really a game though.. :)

item.name: A Fistful of Penguins
item.comment: Nice little dice game. Maybe a bit too complex for such a random filler, but anyhow enjoyable.

item.name: FITS Official Expansion
item.comment: These new boards are cool. Adds to the replayability, definitely.

item.name: Flag Frenzy!
item.comment: VERY much like Dobble. I prefer Dobble much more though. Somehow this felt more confusing and visually did not look that good.

item.name: Fleet
item.comment: The turns go pretty smooth, which is a plus. Somehow the gampeplay feels a bit lacking for me though. The bidding especially felt unexciting. Some cards also felt much better than others (at least after one play).

item.name: Flip Flop Pikku Myy
item.comment: OK children's game. Getting the hands right for Pikku Myy can be difficult.

item.name: Food Chain
item.comment: Nice, easy, educational game play. Nothing too special, but quite enjoyable. After one game, I am however quite afraid that the bear is too good!

item.name: For Sale
item.comment: Nice, fast and easy to grasp and explain.

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment: Not something I am huge fan of myself, but it is quite cool package. Cheap price with cool bits make it even better purchase. The game play probably is bit too easy (we won our first game with the hardest difficulty) and the game probably is quite luck dependent. But again, it is a decent family game.

item.name: Fresco
item.comment:
Solid meadium weight euro-game.
After one play, I was a bit dissapointed to found that it seemed almost impossible to play a strategy that starts by making the easier paint jobs. It is kind of counter-intuitive that if you will have to get the most expensive ones first to do well in the game. So if this is true, the strategy space seems to be smaller than it could be, which would be a shame.

item.name: Friday the 13th
item.comment: Fun but very light card game.

item.name: Fünf Gurken
item.comment: ARghGH. Not for me!

item.name: Funny Bunny
item.comment: Simple luck fest for kids! What's better than that? :)

item.name: Fzzzt!
item.comment: Nice ideas. There are some things that I don't like though. It is very difficult to try to see what robots (parts) you need, for example.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment: This was quite good. There were lots of rules to remember, but not as much as I was afraid of. Also, building the ship wasn't as difficult as building your factory in Factory Fun. Anyway, a pleasant suprise that I would happily play again.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
item.comment: It takes A LOT of time to play this game. I dislike the card play mechanics for combat. Yet, it has some nice qualities as well, like offering some interesting possibilities for meta-gaming and backstabbing... but again, this creates some problems like king-making and player elimination (in practice).

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
item.comment: Whoa, this was quite horrible experience! TONS of text and rule breaking abilities in the cards and the play got quite confusing (and slow too). Of course it all will get easier after you know the game inside out, but there was nothing that would draw my interest to find out more... I thought that some elegance and spirit was definitely lacking.

item.name: The Game: Spiel...so lange du kannst!
Gauntlet of Fools
item.comment: Funny game and nice concept! I could not see myself playing this that many times though. As players score points pretty much the same pace, it can be frustrating for the players dropping out early. Also, it looks that after a while, everybody can see who will be winning the game. The excitement curve towards the end of the game seems to be dropping, which is not optimal I think.

item.name: Genesis
item.comment:
Traded with the designers at Spiel 2010 to a copy of Aether. Looking forward to play this one!
edit 2011: Now played. Felt a bit scripted - kind like the game played itself! Nice theme quickly fades away, unfortunately. In our two player game, it just happened that the other player got an upperedge, and the other player didn't have anything worthwhile to for many turns (there were no cubes to take in the stock)... The rules are quite simple, which is a bonus.

item.name: Ghost Blitz
item.comment: It's OK elegant little minimalistic dexterity game that twists your mind. Feels a bit like Jungle Speed. I find I don't really enjoy these type of games (maybe because I suck at them).

item.name: Glass Road
item.comment: Interesting. I liked some aspects, but can't make my mind about some others. Definitely wan't to play it again and see how it turns out. The game play is anyways quite compact (for modern Uwe), which is a plus to me!

item.name: Glen More
item.comment:
I have a prototype where the main mechanics is quite similar to Glen More. I wanted to check wether it is too similar to develop it further -> that's why I purchased it in the first place...
Anyway, overall the game play is interesting and I like it. There are some details I'm not sure about though (like the Market and moving the workers etc). I'm not too happy about the components either.

item.name: Glory to Rome
item.comment:
Crazy stuff! Don't know yet if it is a good thing or bad... :)
After 3rd play: rating 7 -> 7.5 Refreshingly different.

item.name: Going, Going, GONE!
item.comment: Quite a fresh take on bidding I must say! I was not huge fan how the game played out, but it was not too bad. Anyway, at least it was something new - which is always cool! :)

item.name: GOSU
item.comment: The 4 player game just went on and on and on...

item.name: Guillotine
item.comment:
The basic idea is fun and it is very simple to learn and teach. I don't like how some of the action cards work, however (e.g. change your hand with the opponent - come on!), but that is a minor issue I think.
edit: Lowered my rating from 6 to 5.Ugh, I really dislike how some of the action cards work. I think this could be tuned to a much nicer game, but as it is now, I don't really care to play it again.

item.name: Gulo Gulo
item.comment: Quality kids game.

item.name: Haggis
item.comment: I like the basic idea (I like Tichu a lot). However, with Haggis, getting an overall picture of your hand is quite difficult. Figuring out all options and combos (especially some of the bombs) seems very difficult and slow. The other thing I really didn't like too much of the way the scoring worked the scoring. It felt a bit overly complicated for such a fast game.

item.name: Hai-Alarm!!!
item.comment: hmm, I was not sold after first play.

item.name: Hamsterrolle
item.comment: An OK dexterity game. No great desire to play it again, but won't turn it down, if some one suggests.

item.name: Hanabi
item.comment: Clever deduction game. Easy to explain, but has some depth to it.

item.name: Hansa Teutonica
item.comment: Nice game. Lots of different ways to score points, which is something I don't usually like too much. However, in this game everything works out quite well. I would be happy to play again!

item.name: Havana
item.comment: OK, little game.

item.name: Le Havre
item.comment: Although the rule set was quite confusing, the game play for the first turns were quite straightforward after all. The decision tree grows during the game, as new buildings come to play. It wasn't as agonizing as in Agricola, but interesting still. I'm not sure about the end game though, there are quite many possibilities to try and each of them is quite calculable - the end felt a bit too much optimizing excercise for me (after first play at least). Nevertheless definetely an interesting game I hope to try again soon.

item.name: Heroica: Waldurk
item.comment: I really like the concept here. Unfortunately, the game played as in the rules, really seemed not to work that well.

item.name: Hey, That's My Fish!
item.comment:
OK, light abstract with cool components.
update: rating: 7->8 after more plays. There's definetely more than meets the eye here: the game is about to make your opponent(s) isolated and not about what tile to pick next. You can improve your skill level quite a bit in this game, I believe (which is good). The biggest downside is the setup.

item.name: The Hobbit Card Game
item.comment: Quite random but somewhat amusing trick-taking game. Harmless, but non-interesting.

item.name: Homesteaders
item.comment:
Uuh, I really liked my first play! Lots of interesting options and choices but still the main core of the game is quite easy to understand - not something that can be said about most of the typical eurogames! Rating may very well go up!
edit: second play was even better. 8->8.5. I would love to have a copy... hmmm should I wait for a reprint?

item.name: Hotel Samoa
item.comment: Not bad blind bidding game... but it is still a blind bidding game :) Nothing too special, but everything works very nicely.

item.name: Hotel Tycoon
item.comment: Played this when I was a kid.

item.name: Igloo Pop
item.comment: Fun guessing game with cool components. It was really hard to guess right and most of us end up just loosing points in the game (as you lose points each time you guess wrong). This was little bit disturbing as if we played right, it would mean that for "bad players", passing would always be the best option...

item.name: Imperial
item.comment: Not a bad game, would like to try again.

item.name: In the Year of the Dragon
Ingenious
item.comment: I like the two player game the best.

item.name: Ingenious: Travel Edition
item.comment:
This one of my and my wife's favorite games! Fast but thoughtful - nevertheless it is no brainburner. It is a perfect abstract game!
Three hurrays for Knizia!! :D
e: after ~40 plays the game has finally start to feel little bit too repetetive. Well, it still is a very nice game.

item.name: Innovation
item.comment: Rating based on one play. There definitely are some clever ideas here, but there are a lot of things I don't like as well. I just don't like too much generally these "magic style" combo-buildings games, with teadious action descriptions on the cards. Also, there is lot of fiddling with cards and counting symbols etc. Already with two players it was quite difficult to find out what other players were doing. So all and all, quite a dissapointment unfortunately.. :(

item.name: Inquisitio
item.comment: Initial rating after one play. The first game left me little confused: need to play more to know for sure is it for me or not. I like the theme anyway.

item.name: Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King
Jaipur
item.comment:
I found this game to be quite enjoyable. It is very easy to teach and play, yet not completely trivial (especially the chamel-mechanic works nicely). The quality of components is excellent.
We will see how much replayability value this really has, but it is very nice package. I like easy-to-play 2pl games as a concept and I am always looking for good games for that.

item.name: Jamaica
item.comment: Very pretty. Game play just ok.

item.name: Jericho
item.comment: Felt like old fashioned card game. If you get lucky with the timing, you do well. If not then you lose. Not too interesting.

item.name: Jungle Speed
item.comment: I was not too found of this after few plays.

item.name: K2
item.comment: Well made familyish game, with working theme.

item.name: Keltis
item.comment: So much worse than the original Lost Cities, quite dissapointing! I would bet that the game is pretty much decided with the opening hand (at least in the sense that if you get a horrible start, there's not much you can do). Compared to Lost Cities, many mechanics just strengthen the leader - people who are left behind by bad card draw have very little change to catchup.

item.name: Keltis: Der Weg der Steine Mitbringspiel
item.comment: VERY easy, very random.

item.name: Key Market
item.comment:
Not bad, but despite colorful graphics, actually quite dry.
As in so many other "complex euro-games", there are plenty of rules that are there just to make your optimation process a bit harder (like the rule which tells you how you are allowed to place workers on the fields). I don't like this aspect in games in general.

item.name: King of Tokyo
item.comment: Not bad. Sillyish filler with feeling! :)

item.name: King of Tokyo: Power Up!
item.comment: In our game first, we really did not get that much action for the expansion stuff..

item.name: Kingdom Builder
item.comment:
Thoughts after one play: I like it OK. I don't mind the simplicity or the pick a card and play it -game play. Actually that part of the game is simple and elegant. Different scoring cards give nice variety in game play.
However, the bonus action tokens system, I did not liked too much. They are powerful but bring along quite a bit of AP possibilities (and this should be played as filler to shine). I would have preferred some other system for the special powers. I can see skilled players winning most Of the time because they know how to use them better - possibly even to a point that newbie stands no change against skilled player? (which is not possibly the preferable thing in sdj winner)

item.name: Kingdoms
item.comment: Clean, simple, dry.

item.name: Kings of Air and Steam
item.comment:
Not bad, although I'm not usually too wild about these pick and delivery games. There are quite many similarities to Steam (or Age of), but some nice new angles too.
I must say that I was positively surprised how well it worked as a 7 player game. That's a rare thing!

item.name: Klack!
item.comment: Quite decent speed game for kids.

item.name: Die kleinen Drachenritter
item.comment: Kids game where you stack tiles against the hill. Quite ok.

item.name: Konkurrer med vaskebjørnene
item.comment: Ugh. Terrible...

item.name: Kreta
item.comment: Nice little area majority game. The cards should have symbols on them. I had to check the reference sheet all the time what each card did...

item.name: Lancaster
item.comment: A quality game from Queen. I like the relatively simple game play. But after the dust settles down, it does not stand out as super new or thrilling. But my main wibes were positive and I could gladly play it again.

item.name: Las Vegas
item.comment:
Simple little dice game! I was definitely positively surprised. The rules are easy and elegant yet there are some semi-interesting choices to make. That's a real grail-challenge in game design, and Vegas does it pretty OK :)
Update: rating 7 -> 8 after second play. I really enjoy this quick and elegant game. It really fools you to believe that you can be skilfully and its not completely random :)

item.name: Last Will
item.comment:
Initial rating: 8.
Cool and smooth combo-building game! Will add more comments after playing few more games.

item.name: Leader 1
item.comment: Some neat ideas, but I did find some of the mechanics to be not too elegant...

item.name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy
item.comment: First impressions after incomplete game: interesting, want to try out again.

item.name: Legends of Andor
item.comment: SUPER beautiful! Unfortunately game play wasn't as exciting. Lots of reading cards and fiddling around for very little and somewhat unexciting game play. I like the idea that you could learn the game by playing - but to me this game is a tad too complicated and fiddly for that. It all ends up easily with lots of frustration. Therefore, to me, it misses its goal.

item.name: Level X
item.comment: Very easy rules. Easy but interesting dice games are difficult but interesting genre. I think the gameplay here was OK, maybe bit too trivial though.

item.name: Ligretto
item.comment: ARgh.

item.name: The Little Prince: Make Me a Planet
item.comment: Not bad light simple little game.

item.name: Loch Ness
item.comment: Thematically most aspects in the game work very well: for example taking pictures or moving the monster. Downside is that most of the time is spent taking tiles from the bag (which is not that exciting).But not bad overall.

item.name: London
item.comment: Not bad. But not uber great either.

item.name: Loopin' Louie
item.comment: Ok, it is fun for 10 minutes, but what after that? :)

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
item.comment:
Initial rating after one play.
I'm not generally big fan of this kind of "fiddling with cards and markers and tons of text" -type of card games. LotRtCG seem to be definitely better than many other games of this type though. The combat mechanic especially wasn't that bad. But I was not drawn by many of the card abilities and I felt no desire to start build a deck of my own.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation (Deluxe Edition)
Lost Cities
item.comment: Very fast, fun little game! It is easy to play and explain.

item.name: Lost Legends
item.comment: Pretty good and tight design! I like the draft & crawl dynamics. My only worries are replayability, scoring and snowballing (or better, lack of it for the unlucky ones that fall behind...)

item.name: Love Letter
item.comment: Wonderful little game! Have to admire the simplicity and elegance of it... and yet still there is a game there.

item.name: Machi Koro
item.comment: Sympathetic little game. The game might be in essence quite trivial (once you figure out the choices that give you the best odds) and I think there are some balance issues, but it was quite fun and enjoyable to play anyhow, at least once.

item.name: Machi Koro: Harbor Expansion
item.comment: I like the more reactive (10 different tiles available) game play much better than the original. This game is somehow nicely amusing :)

item.name: Mage Knight Board Game
item.comment:
Initial rating.
This game has lots of stuff going on. Some of it is very cool! I really like how the leveling up works by building up your deck and learning new skills. The game has good progression all the way - characters and enemies get better etc.
I am partial for the puzzle type combat. It reminds a lot of what Dungeon Lords has (although there you can do it simultaneously, I think). This creates a lot of downtime and I don't think it feels too exciting or rewarding to slash the enemies as it could be. I think also that the combat is perhaps just a bit too complicated for my tastes. Learning all the special skills and powers is huge commitment and it is easy to play something wrong.
I'm not sure if I really like the how the round structure works (day and night cycles + playing until the deck is exhausted + and after one player announces the turn end).
The game has nice theme, but it feels mostly like a solo-puzzle type game. Not that there is anything wrong with this type of games. Just don't expect too much direct interaction in the game.

item.name: The Magic Labyrinth
item.comment: Super!

item.name: Mago Magino
item.comment: Pretty Ok kids game!

item.name: Mamma Mia!
item.comment: Nice and silly card game. It has a memory element, but that just part of the charm!

item.name: Manhattan
item.comment: This is an old game, and you definetely see that from the gameplay. Not bad, but not too good either.

item.name: Mare Nostrum
item.comment:
Wow, our 6 player game took 6+ hours to play... but yes, we finished it! :)
I really like some of the ideas here. Graphics are cool too. BUT. I believe there are many problems with this game (we played with the Mythology Expansion). For us, the game was endless back-and-forth excercise. No one wanted to trade anything and game just stalled for 4 hours. I guess with certain playing style, the game would work better. BUT I believe it is the game to blame, if it cannot naturally push players to the right direction. Some elegant systems, but I believe that the soul of the game (cards, trading and winning conditions), while nice, doesn't really work or is too fragile. Dissapointing.

item.name: Mare Nostrum: Mythology Expansion
item.comment:
Disclaimer: I've played only one game of Mare Nostrum and we used this expansion.
Anyway, I understand that the expansion fixes some balance issues and brings the 6th player. This is all good. But the Gods I don't really like as an addition. And I don't think the game is really fixed with this expansion, thus my low rating (see my comments about the base game...)

item.name: Marrakech
item.comment: Cool and simple family game.

item.name: Mascarade
item.comment: Game play a bit similar to Coup (which I like). I thought this felt quite random and I wasn't fan of the memory element in the game... Artwork/production was absolutely brilliant though!

item.name: Maus au Chocolat
item.comment: I liked this game OK. Blind bidding game done in an interesting way - lots of luck, not too hard, but some interesting decisions here and there.

item.name: Medici vs Strozzi
item.comment: Ouch, i will definitely not want to play this again! That's why the low rating, despite some elegance and cleverity of the design (I like Medici quite a bit). This game, is more than any other game i have played so far, a true min-maxing zero-sum excercise. No hidden information - s*it you could even write an algorithm to find the optimal solution each step!

item.name: Memoir '44
item.comment: Very easy wargame, with lots of luck. It's fun anyway.

item.name: Memory
item.comment: Memory games are simple and elegant and kids usually like these. So quite good classic all in all - assuming you like memory games... ;)

item.name: Merchants & Marauders
item.comment: Some good, some bad. Great artwork and wonderful ideas! The execution felt a bit undeveloped though. Many corners could have been rounded. For example, Glory Cards felt something that I thought could have been easily left out from the game, some other stuff as well..

item.name: Middle Kingdom
item.comment: 2pl game does not work too well. With 5 players feels better; felt pretty random though.

item.name: Mit List und Tücke
item.comment: Very cool ideas. I felt also that it was more intuitive to play than an ordinary trick-taking game. Probably most will disagree on this, however... :)

item.name: Modern Art
item.comment: Excellent game! You just need the right (analytical) group for this one.

item.name: Mogel Motte
item.comment: Very cool little game about cheating and simple card play! We had some good laughs on this one due to its absurdity! :D

item.name: Mondo
item.comment: I am usually fan of puzzle games, but this one seemed to me a bit bland and uninteresting. The rules are not too difficult but it is not super elegant neither. The scoring of areas and penalties are not that intuitive.

item.name: Monster-Falle
item.comment: Ok children's game. The semi- co-op play is interesting, but perhaps a bit confusing for some kids.

item.name: Monty Python Fluxx
item.comment: ARGH!

item.name: Mouse Match
item.comment: Cute and clever kids game. Did not get us too excited, but on the other hand our family is usually never too into games with heavy memory aspects.

item.name: Mow
item.comment: Fun and easy to play. Very random. I'm not sure how many times this would be fun to play, but the first time was OK.

item.name: Mr. Jack
item.comment: Nice deduction game for 2 players. Can be quite brainburning! My biggest complaint about the game is that it usually feels that the winner is the one who doesn't make a mistake. This reminds me Chess and is something that I'm not too fond in gaming.

item.name: Mü & More
item.comment: My rating is only for Last Panther (I haven't played the other games in the box).

item.name: My First Carcassonne
item.comment: Extremely simple and elegant rules, easy enough for small kids as well. However, as an adult, I didn't find the game play too interesting...

item.name: Nacht der Magier
item.comment: Nice pieces and Gimmick, but the setup and hassle is pretty huge for such a super short game. Also, I was not too convinced on the game play...

item.name: Nations
item.comment:
Preliminary protype rating.
Simple and clean core mechanics. Yet most things follow the theme nicely. Good job!
Our play felt a bit longish and there is some tuning to be done. The interaction is quite limited between players (this is good or bad, depending on your tastes). Anyway, my overall feeling of the game after the first play was pretty positive.

item.name: Navegador
item.comment: Dryish Euro. Well thought out and balanced though.

item.name: Neuroshima Hex!
item.comment: Some aspects were interesting, but overal the core and details were not that engaging for me.

item.name: Nino Delfino
item.comment: The game itself is not that special, but the Gimmick is quite cool! :)

item.name: Noah
item.comment: OK, but forgettable memory game :)

item.name: Notre Dame
item.comment: Fun and quite fast.

item.name: Nuclear War
item.comment: One of the worst I have played. It has everything: player elimination, total randomness, no strategy, you name it! We had some laughs though when the first guy was immediately eliminated when THE first card in the game was played... :)

item.name: Olympos
item.comment:
Initial rating.
The first play was maybe a bit of dissapointing for me. The basic idea is quite simple, but there are lots of things to consider. Also, I think the graphical design could perhaps been better to help understand all the information. Anyway, potential AP risk in the game for sure.
I think it is a quite nice concept itself, but don't expect any deep Civilization experience with this. Need to play to more to really see how interesting it is in the long run.
edit: rating up from 7 to 7.5 after more plays, I feel better about it. If players are playing fast, it can be a satisfying experience.

item.name: On the Underground
item.comment: I didn't find this very interesting.

item.name: Once Upon a Time: Dark Tales
item.comment: Nothing too special here.

item.name: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game
item.comment: I very much like the basic idea and concept. Although there isn't much of a game here and what the experience will turn out to be, depends heavily on the group, I still kind of like it. Anyhow, I think this could have been done a bit better...hmmm I smell a challenge! :)

item.name: Onirim
item.comment:
Ooh, graphics look awesome. The concept sounds nice too!
edit: bought at Essen 2010. Very clever concept and looks good. There are some issues, however, the game play is not smooth enough for me - there is just a bit too much shuffling and other stuff that has to be maintained. Also how well you do in the game depends very heavily on luck. You have to discard few keys in one color and you lose the game. I think with a bit more development this could have been excellent, now it is OK. Graphics and the feeling is great anyhow!
edit2: I realized that we played the key thing wrong - you don't necessarily need the key symbols to get the doors... I think this might help a lot! :)

item.name: Opera
item.comment: Nothing big to complaint about, everything works OK. I just didn't find it very engaging (after one play).

item.name: Oregon
item.comment: Quite decent family game.

item.name: Packet Row
item.comment: Elegant and well designed compact game about shipping goods! Somehow I should like it even more than I actually did. Cleverness and elegance does not always guarantee that enjoyable game experience I guess... but it was still pretty good.

item.name: The Palaces of Carrara
item.comment: Quite boring game. I kind of like the scoring of sets and the wheel, but they are not interesting enough to make the game stand out.

item.name: Palastgeflüster
item.comment: The main mechanic was quite interesting and enjoyable. However, a bit longish and the scoring was a bit problematic.

item.name: Pampas Railroads
item.comment: Very good; intriguing! I probably would rate it higher if the graphical representation would be better...

item.name: Panic Tower!
item.comment: Actually quite horrible experience. I have no desire to try this again... I definitely prefer more traditional tower building games compared to this.

item.name: Paris Connection
item.comment: The system itself is very elegant. It is a extremely simpe train game withouth any money! Using trains as stocks and as route markers is quite clever. But unfortunately, I did not find the game play to be very interesting. Also, the setup is quite annoying for such a short game.

item.name: Pasha
item.comment: Simple and elegant family dice rolling game. Me like!

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
item.comment:
The basic idea that charachters develop from game to game is excellent (and something I've been thinking about quite a bit myself too). The rpg feel mostly comes from character development and skill checks with dice. There really is not that much theme to it and I think it all is fundamentally quite abstract. While the "piles of location decks" -system worked mechanically pretty well, I found it not giving me the immersive experience. Flip a card, resolve it b rolling a die, etc... There is still some distance left to the full rpg experience!
Also, mechanically the core card play mechanic could have been perhaps a bit better structured. Now it can be a bit confusing when and how you can play your cards.
All in all, I found this game OKish.

item.name: Pelican Cove
item.comment:
A bit of a dissapointment as I usually like this kind of abstracts. The 'theme' is very disconnected and the original theme would have supported the game play much better (although salewise I can see why the current one was chosen).
The biggest problem for me was that that the symbols in the cards are not all very clear. For such a simple game, and clever concept, the cards should be more easy to understand quickly. Also, the colors of the pawns did not match the pictures perfectly. These kind of shortcoming in the physical execution distract the game play and make it harder than it should be. It wouldn't matter that much for some other game, but this is a speed game...

item.name: Peloponnes
item.comment: Nice. Flows fast.

item.name: Peloponnes Expansion
item.comment: Nice addition. Not necessary though, unless you are playing with 6 players, of course.

item.name: Pergamon
item.comment: Decent, straightforward family game (or fillerish game for gamers). My biggest gripe with this fine game is that evaluation of tiles (where and how they fit) can be a bit tricky for such a light game.

item.name: Pickomino
item.comment: OK dice game. Bit too long, or at least feels like it (after one play).

item.name: Piece o' Cake
item.comment: Nice idea. Easy game, but how to divide the cake can be really dificult, especially in the end game (=AP).

item.name: PitchCar
item.comment: Nice dexterity game and the racing theme works well here. I prefer Crokinole though.

item.name: Potato Man
item.comment: Pretty good and clever trick-taking game.

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment:
Not a bad game at all. Just too much unecessary number crunching for me. Also I don't like the PG maps, too many big numbers - where's the elegance!! :)
Edit: Uh, I REALLY hate the counting. On the other hand, there are lots of things to like here. Very hard to rate properly.

item.name: Power Grid: Factory Manager
item.comment:
OK game. Felt a bit that the game was playing almost itself and your decisions really weren't that important (or that it was too difficult to see what would happen). I might be wrong though.
After second play, I lowered my rating 7->5. The mechanics are all fine, but I don't feel fun at all when playing this game...

item.name: Power Grid: The First Sparks
item.comment:
To be honest, I was quite dissapointed with this one. I can see that the idea was make a version of Power Grid that would be faster and include less number crunching. In theory, I think it is a good idea (I don't enjoy the number crunching part in Power Grid). However, this game just felt flat.
The main structure of Power Grid is actually quite confusing (you have many different phases that you go in different player orders). But this all makes sense in Power Grid. When there is a lot of thinking and turns take a bit longer, this kind of cubbersome turn-structure is OK. But with less-meaty game, it just felt a bit teadious and un-elegant.
As there were no auctions, this game seriously lacked the nice tension Power Grid has. Also, one of our players got locked into a situation were he couldn't produce any money - I mean food. I think he played very poorly, but still it wasn't good thing to see player eliminated in this kind of game...
On the plus side, the game looked nice and the theme is very funny.

item.name: Power Struggle
item.comment: As in so many heavier games, this has lot rules to remember (at least a lot for the first play). But it was good. Everything seemed to be well thought out and polished. I like the theme as well.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment:
One of the very best - I love it! I prefer to play with four (experienced) players, and after that with three players. With five players, there is not enough control to the game IMHO. Also, it is best to play with an experienced group. But when you put these shortcomings aside, you can just enjoy the elegance :)
2011 edit: lowered the rating from 10 to 9. Although it is highly elegant masterpiece, it feels at the same time already a bit old-fashioned. Especially on the re-playability side (the games have been evolved especially on this, I think). There just seems to be too little variation and you end up buying almost the same buildings each game. Nowdays, it just doesn't feel enough to learn just the nyances of a game, unfortunately...

item.name: Puerto Rico: Expansion I – New Buildings
item.comment: Some new buildings are fun. Some not so great. Anyway, an OK expansion to a great game.

item.name: Quarriors!
item.comment: Quite easy and casual dice version of Dominion typish game. The game felt very random, actually even so that probably most of the strategy and nyances get really buried under the random nature of the game. But dice rolling is always fun, it is easy and fast to play and the custom dice are simply cool, so I have to give some points for those :)

item.name: Quoridor Kid
item.comment:
We played with 4 adults, which turned it to really mean brain burner abstract! With adults, it definetely seems to be best with just two players. With four players, people can srew your plans big time.
With kids it propably will be played a bit more casual manner and propably works very well too.

item.name: Qwirkle
item.comment: It's an OK clever game alright, but the gameplay doesn't feel that fun for me. And counting the scores is just really hard work!

item.name: Qwixx
item.comment: Very simple and fast dice game.

item.name: Ra
item.comment: Very good auction game. I like the fact that unlike most of the auction games, [i]what[/i] to bid is not the main point, but [i]when[/i] is more important. This makes the game more easy-going. The bidding mechanism is elegant and works very well.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment:
This is just a perfect game: it is fast, there is almost no downtime(!), plays great from 2 to 4, each game feels different. Also compared to the very fast playing time 20-40 min, this is very deep game!
Maybe the only downside is that it is little hard to explain to newcomers.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Alien Artifacts
item.comment: I haven't yet played with the orb, but the other cards seem to be reasonably interesting --> interesting content to explore and that's great! After all, RFTG is one of the greatest games ever invented (by humankind, at least).

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
item.comment: Military 'strategy' becomes too powerful with this exansion IMHO. Some cards are nice but overall makes the game play more dull and luck driven in my mind. The very big deck is also a problem.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Brink of War
item.comment:
Some new cards -> mainly positive, although some of them are quite complicated... Even more cards in the deck -> very negative. Prestige -> didn't like that after two plays (rich get richer problem, for example).
I still prefer Race played with the first expansion only.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
item.comment: Really good expansion. Terraforming guild is too powerful card however. We play with a variant that you only score 1 vp for each windfall in your tableau.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Xeno Invasion
Railways of the World
item.comment:
Easier to play than Steam for example, as there is a lot more room in the map to expand your railroads. I don´t like the cards however. Otherwise a nice game.
Beware: you need a huge board to play this game!

item.name: Rapido
item.comment: Clicking itself is decent fun, but as a game it's not great... I guess it would be fun for some kids, but won't do that much for adults.

item.name: Rat-a-Tat Cat
item.comment: Funny little memory card game. Nothing spectacular.

item.name: Rattus
item.comment: My first thoughts about the game weren't that positive, but after the full game I felt much better. Nothing spectacular but decent one. It is fast and simple game.

item.name: The Resistance: Avalon
item.comment: Initial rating. Interesting game, want to play more!

item.name: Revolver
item.comment:
Athmosphere is nice, but I was not too enthuastic or engaged about the rest of the game, unfortunately.
Update after 3 plays, rating: 5.5->6. It feels a bit better now. It is quite fast and easygoing, which is nice. The game play however feels sometimes too obvious. I have a feeling that paying optimally is not too difficult and in the end, luck of the draw is what really matters.

item.name: Rialto
item.comment: Pretty ok euro game. At least with two players the doge track felt quite uninteresting. Also the area bonus felt dominantly crucial (it's a 10vp swing).

item.name: Ribbit
item.comment: Very cool little game! It worked suprisingly well as 2 player game for adults. I suppose it is better with less players as you have more interesting moves you can make. I have to try with kids next, but it definetely has a place in my collection already!

item.name: Ricochet Robots
item.comment: A puzzle type brainburner. You need the right group and the right moment to play this game, but if so, it can be quite fun! :)

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
RoboRally
item.comment: Much better than I thought. Despite its shortcomings (there are some), this really was (mostly) fun to play.

item.name: Robotory
item.comment: Ok, you have to give a lot of credit for the game for being so simple and fast. But honestly as a game, i think it will get very boring and repetitive after few games - or that's my thouhgt after single game anyways :)

item.name: Rockband Manager
item.comment:
Some nice ideas and mechanics, but bit too long and too much possibilites for AP.
Although games that have many different steps/stages are nice (they develop a better story), the price you have to pay is in the more complicated and detailed rules. This happens here as well to some degree. Compared to the fillerish/luck-driven nature of the game, I think it is a bit too long and slow-moving.

item.name: Roll for the Galaxy
item.comment: Some clever ideas, but unfortunately, it has quite unintuitive game play --> becomes easily confusing to play and explain

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
item.comment: Fast dice game that is fun to play.

item.name: Roma
item.comment: Not bad light dice+card game. Wasn't super-duber thrilled about it altogether but there was some nice ideas/aspects in the game for sure.

item.name: Runewars
item.comment:
Initial feeling with the game was quite positive. Would like to play again!
It is difficult genre but Runewars seemed to succeed it quite OKish. I didn't found the fighting mechanic interesting though (after one play). Also the heroes felt really disconnected from the main game play.

item.name: S-Evolution
item.comment: I felt it was quite interesting little strange game.

item.name: Saint Petersburg
item.comment:
There is strange enjoyment, when playing this game. Also the graphics in this game are nice. The downside seems to be that it is very hard for a newcomer to win this game.
update: Still like it a lot. The expansion makes it better.

item.name: Saint Petersburg: New Society & Banquet Expansion
item.comment: Banquet expansion cards didn't impress me. Otherwise a great addition to a great game!

item.name: Samarkand: Routes to Riches
item.comment: Feelings after the first play: a bit disappointed and mixed. I have to play again to know for sure, but it felt a bit unrewarding and there was plenty to setup and hasle. Not quite as elegant rule-wise as I was hoping. I was not convinced for some of the design choices (like how joining the families, double building, etc worked). But as said, I would like to to try it out again.

item.name: Samurai
item.comment: Very solid game! Plays well with 2,3 and 4.

item.name: Samurai Sword
item.comment: Re-theming Bang! with few new twists. It is still very much like bang, although the theme does not work quite that well in my opinion.

item.name: Samurai: The Card Game
item.comment: The gameplay is quite similar to Samurai, but I think it has some nice new ideas. The game takes a lot of space and the graphical design could be way better (the village tiles definetely should be more easy to see just with a glance). The gameplay was interesting, although I'm bit worried that how the village cards come from the deck might decide the victory, at least with players roughly the same skill level.

item.name: San Juan
item.comment:
This is a nice game. However, I think that there is maybe too less interaction and variety so that after 5-10 games the games start to feel maybe little bit too much the same.
I think also that San Juan does not play well with 4 players, that is because there is just 5 actions cards and the fourth player has only 2 choices left and third player only 3 choices.

item.name: San Marco
item.comment: I think the "pie-dividing mechanics" would work better, if there would be more asymmetry.

item.name: Santa Cruz
item.comment: Very nice, fast moving and simple family game!

item.name: Savannah Tails
item.comment: Easy racing game. A bit meh. I definetely prefer Snow Tails.

item.name: Schotten-Totten
item.comment: Fast, but brain burning (in a good way). Very solid game.

item.name: Schweinebande
item.comment: Nice and easy family game.

item.name: Seasons
item.comment: Initial rating 7: Decently interesting semi-light card game. Time and more plays will tell how this will end up!

item.name: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective
item.comment:
Difficult to rate this beast...
I really would like to love this. It is overall well executed: has great atmosphere and unique game play. BUT I was super disapointed in the ending of our story in our scenario. There were 3 main motives/aspects how the murder could have happened - in the end only one of these was anyway relevant! No connection between these 3 things. This is unacceptable for me!! If you try to make sense of the story, it is VERY cheap to assume that the crazy unlikely hints are noway connected... DEUS EX MACHINA all over it :/

item.name: Shrimp
item.comment: Speed game. Crazy theme! I was not really especially thrilled about the game play.

item.name: Siberia: The Card Game
item.comment: OK card game. I am afraid that the strategic decisions would not be that interesting after few games as the initial setup is always the same for helper cards --> play style will probably settle into an equilibrium and each game would be pretty much similar (from the "grand strategy" side, at least)

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
item.comment:
I was quite dissapointed with the game. It had surprisingly many superficial similiraties to the computer game (which I like a lot) but I don't thimk these choices work optimally in a board game...
The main problems I had with the game: - the production/trade/culture collection mechanism (around your cities) was very boring. Calculating each time the same stuff felt just very unelegant and teadious. - The combat was very abstract and not at all satisfying. - If you don't get to build your second city very early, you are basically out from the game. - I believe that the higher level techs, units etc, don't have too much effect in the game. If one of the players is able to develop those techs, the game is so close to the end that players cannot really use these too much. The game doesn't really therefore span the whole history of the world. - The wonders were very uninteresting and weak. As the early ones were too expensive to build, the more powerful ones didn't even come to play in our game.
My main problem for me in the game was however that the game didn't feel like proper epic civilization building game. It just didn't feel that I was building huge civilization, nor that each turn would take hundreds of years. Maybe it was because the high level of abstraction? The tech pyramid had some nice new idea (although many techs just felt superior) and was maybe the best part in the game IMHO.

item.name: Skyline
item.comment: Nice little random dice game :)

item.name: Small World
item.comment: Very good and compact conquering game! Just fills the certain niche, that you don't see too often in board games. My biggest complaint is that the setup takes some time and there is quite a lot of stuff that get's easily all messed up in the game box. It is a bit fiddly.

item.name: Small World: Cursed!
item.comment:
The new additions aren't really that interesting...
edit: they are pretty bad actually

item.name: Space Alert
item.comment: Interesting concept. Unfortunately, I found myself not enjoying too much of the game play, even though my hopes were semi-high. But not bad.

item.name: Space Cadets
item.comment:
Unique game, for sure - I don't know anything like this, so bonus points for that!
Other than that, I'm not too found of the game. It takes AGES to explain the rules and do the setup. There are ~8 different games here which all tie together in rather complicated way. Our first game took 3h+ without rule explanation(and we exploded, so we were not close to finish it by winning). Rules explanation took 1-1,5h... and the game is quite light and random! That's always veeery problematic combo.

item.name: Speed Cups
item.comment: Quite a good speed game! The problem for me is just that I'm not huge fan of speed games / they never see too much play with my groups.

item.name: Spooky Stairs
item.comment: Cool components and very easy to play as well. Nice kids game.

item.name: Spot it!
item.comment: Brilliantly simple little game. Original design or not, it is an excellent game.

item.name: Die Sprache des Manitu
item.comment: A word game for kids. It didn´t work at all with adults and I doubt it would be a big hit with kids either.

item.name: Spyrium
item.comment: Clever basic idea. not bad. Yet still a bit bland/meh.

item.name: Steam
item.comment: I like some aspects of the game a lot, some aspects not so much. Track building is quite unthematic (the longer route from A to B is better!). Also, who will eventually get what cube delivered seemed to be really chaotic and hard to figure out (but still is really important in the game).

item.name: Steam Park
item.comment: Not horrible, but there is quite a bit of waiting, yet very little interaction. Feels like this type of game should be made all simultaneous to make it more enjoyable. The production values are very nice though.

item.name: Steel Driver
item.comment:
Not bad, but I'm slightly worried that the end game is A) too random (too hard to figure out what will happen), B) very important. In our game, the end game payout was something like 70% of the whole income during the game.
Also, it is interesting that the game is quite tactical and almost the only strategy comes what shares you want to have at the end of the game. But again, what shares are the best ones, is not very easy to figure out..

item.name: Stich-Meister
item.comment: Trick-taking game where each game is different (and a bit crazy). I'm not huge fan of trick-taking games but this was OK. It felt however a bit like an inside-joke for the trick-gaming fans...

item.name: Sticheln
item.comment: OK tric-taking game.

item.name: Sticht oder Nicht
item.comment: Trick taking game with few nice twists.

item.name: Stone Age
item.comment: Same old, same old -feeling, when playing this game. Nicely done though.

item.name: A Study in Emerald
item.comment: I like the theme and setting. But even though the game play had some nice touches, if still didn't feel great as a whole. Everything was bit too clunky really to click for me.

item.name: Sumeria
item.comment: Solid game.

item.name: Sun, Sea & Sand
item.comment: There are some nice ideas here (like the delay getting back your workers), but overall at least the first game left a bit of an underdeveloped feeling. For such a simple game, I think there are too many small details to remember/understand (especially how the backpackers work). Also, the economics of the game seemed to be quite strange (in our game at least). First, money was really tight, but after a while, there was nothing to really spend it all. Maybe we played it using a "wrong strategy", but I think it is important that game is not too fragile for this kind of "dumb play".

item.name: Taj Mahal
item.comment: After first play: very good Knizia quality. Maybe a bit dry and a bit too chaotic perhaps?

item.name: Take 5!
item.comment:
It felt like there would be more control than in the regular 6 nimmt, but I'm not sure after all.
Anyway, OK little card game.

item.name: Targi
item.comment: Very cool 2 player game!

item.name: Tash-Kalar: Arena of Legends
item.comment: Abstract game with some combo-building and high interaction (which felt quite non-predictable/~random in the first play). It felt a bit too AP/brainburning at some moments. But not bad, happy to try again.

item.name: Telmivät tenavat
item.comment: Nice sporty/dexterity supporting game for the smallest kids in the household.

item.name: Tempelschatz
item.comment: Elegant memory game.

item.name: Terra Mystica
item.comment: Initial Rating. Interesting game, would like to play again.

item.name: Thebes
item.comment: Great family type game with lots of luck. Best game in this genre that I know. Luck doesn't bother me though as it is so well suited to the theme. Very beautiful graphics too!

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
item.comment:
Initial rating/feeling after one game (short game): 6. Oh man this game is fiddly...
updated rating after second (full) game: 6-->7. It has its good parts, for sure. However, in the end, it feels quite abstracted and restrictive.
