I'm not sure I like the randomness related to the events and card when combined with very restrictive mechanics (like that there is very little you can do, if you don't have say enough materials or food). For example, I don't think it is very intuitive that if you happen to end in a situation where you produce too much food, it will eat you alive as you cannot produce hardly any metal (due to corruption)... to cure the mess, you need to do quite convoluted steps. There isn't too much flexibility in the game, which I kind of miss (for such a long and complicated game, where it is easy to screw yourself and the luck plays its part too). And of course its long and complicated game with lots of rules and details you need to remember.
But despite my ramblings, obviously it is good and clever game.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Märklin
item.comment: I slightly prefer the original (after one play).

item.name: Tigris & Euphrates
item.comment:
I'm a huge Knizia fan, and I was disappointed with this game when first playing. I think I have to still try this game couple of more times to see if I change my opinion...
e: feels little better now

item.name: Time's Up! Title Recall!
item.comment:
My first experience with the Time's up! -series. We played with the Finnish speaking players, and we didn't know many of the titles... that isn't optimal, as you really are are sometimes forced to say direct translations of the titles.
Anyway, we had quite fun and the main concecpt is excellent! I really like how it gets better every round and how the tension grows.

item.name: Timeline
item.comment: Very nice - Timeline is a super light card game about history. I think you can even learn something when playing this game! Elegant stuff.

item.name: Tiny Epic Kingdoms
item.comment: Quite OK little game. However, I'm a bit afraid that the conflict part will reduce in most cases to the common problem in the genre: "two will fight, the third one will benefit".

item.name: To Court the King
item.comment: Seems really hard to catch up, if you get some bad rolls...

item.name: Tobago
item.comment: Tobago is visually one of the nicest games I have played. The base mechanic (playing the clue cards) is quite nice as well. There maybe are too many fiddly things and rules to make this a true family game classic though. So I understand why this didn't win the SdJ.

item.name: Tori
item.comment: The core mechanics is interesting and everything works out very smoothly - nice! My only 'complaint' is that this is very tactical and maybe even a bit chaotic game. I usually prefer more strategical games. But anyhow it is quite enjoyable game.

item.name: Tournay
item.comment: Only one play so I will be gentle... I did not find this particulary interesting. I hated the confusing symbols already on Troyes and this is mostly just reading those symbols. Behind those symbols, cards seemed mostly be quite uninteresting to me.

item.name: Trajan
item.comment: Some cool elements and a solid game, but for my preferences the game has bit too much stuff and it takes a bit too long to play too. I would have prefered some streamlining.

item.name: TransAmerica
item.comment: Very easy train game. More than easy to teach and play.

item.name: Treasure Chest
item.comment: My rating is for the San Juan expansion. Adds more variability to the game, which is much needed. Not all the cards were that great though, but OK still.

item.name: Triumvirate
item.comment:
I like it. The hidden information is nice and there are also some subleties in the game play (which I always like). However, towards end of the game, if you don't draw enough cards in the colors you have placed the bet, you are lost, this is a aspect that I'm very worried about.
edit: I lowered my rating from 7->6.I do believe it comes to the luck of draw whether or not you can win the right colors on the crucial moment.

item.name: Troyes
item.comment: One of those non-intuitive euros with so many disconnected mechacics. But some of the mechanics are nice and I guess after few plays you get better grip of it. But for my taste, it lacks some story, elegance and spirit.

item.name: Tsuro
item.comment: Very easy rules and fast to play. I don't know how much this one has replayability but the first games were OK fun.

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition)
item.comment: Hmm.. Not very elegant and there's lots of downtime. I nevertheless like some parts of the game and epic Scifi is always a fun idea. Definetely not worth the 8 hours it takes.

item.name: Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar
item.comment: Rather interesting and balanced euro game with cool gear-system-twist!

item.name: Ubongo
item.comment: Nice puzzle game. Maybe little bit too easy though... :P

item.name: Ubongo 3D
item.comment: Oh man this game is tough to play! Great game anyway.

item.name: Ubongo Extreme
item.comment: Really nice puzzle game. Hard too. You want try to solve the puzzle even after the time has already run out, which is a good sign.

item.name: Ubongo: Duel
item.comment: Harder version of the regular Ubongo for two players.

item.name: UGO!
item.comment: Quite interesting trick-taking game. Not bad!

item.name: Ultimate Werewolf: Ultimate Edition
item.comment: Kind a cool party game, but has some problems: The first round is basically random choice, it has player elimination (which of course makes it fun too!) and it can take stall, but otherwise is fun.

item.name: Vanuatu
item.comment: Interesting main mechanics and setting. High AP potential. Lots of screwage - not always in a good way :)

item.name: Vasco da Gama
item.comment: I loved the worker activation mechanic, bu not so much about the rest of the game - it was OK, I guess. I think that the different mechanics, while cute, didn't quite clicked together. Sending your ships away seemed to be quite hard to control especially.

item.name: Village
item.comment:
Nice elements in the game. I especially enjoyed the "take a cube, make an action mechanic". Also, theme was more stronger than in most modern games, which is a big plus.
However, I would have liked the game to be a bit more compact. It is pretty long and there are many different aspects to the game - perhaps few too many for my personal euro-game resource management niche. I can see the first few games people are exploring the choices, but after that the game could start to feel samey. Personally i prefer games that push you to different directions and force you to explore new strategies - village does not do it too much.
Oh yeah, and the seeding of the cubes and placing stickers really are quite fiddly and irritating things to do.

item.name: Voll in Fahrt
item.comment: Interesting but perhaps a bit too tricky and long for a kids game?

item.name: Völuspá
item.comment: OK tactical abstract. The end game bogged down for us though. I think it probably works best as a 2 or 3 player game, where you can probably try to do more planning ahead.

item.name: War of the Ring (first edition)
item.comment:
Only 1 play so far. This one is very difficult to rate.
For first, it takes way too long to setup and quite too long time to play.
The graphics and miniatures are very cool, but make the game play bit difficult and annoying from time to time I was playing the Mordor and failed to notice that you can directly move from the north to Minas Morgul... which cost me the game actually. The map is a bit difficult to read and manage.
Also, I'm not 100% convinced that the action dice are optimal decision limiting tool for such a long game. You can get very much screwed by the dice. For example, in our play the fellowship did not throw a single fellowship move (nor the joker action) during his 3 first turns. That's pretty bad.
However, I like many of the mechanics. I like how the fellowship works and how you get more dice etc. Mechanics go very well hand in hand with the excellent theme. I liked the feel of the game, it really feels like playing a LotR game.
There is slightly too many minor rules for my taste. Even so they work well with the great theme, they tend to slow the game and it is very difficult to keep them all in your head, when playing.
Anyway, I still want to try it again. It had lots of upsides too.

item.name: Where Art Thou Romeo?
item.comment: Gets points for being simple. Yet unfortunately I did not found the game to be too interesting to play... :(

item.name: Wits & Wagers
item.comment: Not bad for a trivia game! I don't like the fact that the last bidding is so overly important though...

item.name: Wizard
item.comment: I'm not great fan of trick-taking games, but after 1 play, I think Wizards might even be my favorite of the genre. I really like the structure of the game: its quite straightforward first (only 1 card dealt), but gets more complicated after each round. Also, you get more points each round on average as the game progresses, which is a nice touch.

item.name: The World Cup Card Game 2010
item.comment: Excellent theme! :) But the game play is..umh.. well, not my favorite.

item.name: Würfelwurst
item.comment: Funny and frustrating game. Argh.

item.name: YINSH
item.comment: Nice abstract. Quite many options but at least after one play, it seemed that there was some room for long term planning (which is something I really want in an abstract game).

item.name: Yspahan
item.comment:
An OK game. Didn't blow my mind but was fun to play.
After one game, it seemed to me that you should alway build all your buildings - there are always 2-3 building that really help your strategy and as the rest of the buildings give you 20-15 vp:s so you should build them anyway... if this is true, it is quite boring. I would perhaps change the scoring for the buildings linear: 5vp/5vp/5vp/5vp/5vp instead of 0vp/0vp/5vp/5vp/10vp

item.name: Zebra-Schwein
item.comment: Ok family game. The idea of mixing animals is nice. More fun if players are bad enough in drawing! :)

item.name: Zeppelin Attack!
item.comment: For deckbuilding games, I found myself liking more of "clean designs" because they help me to control and understand the strategies how to build my deck --> generate the depth in the game. With this one, I felt there was too much unnecessary noise hindering the experience and reducing the strategies. There was quite a bit of luck involved too (which necessarily is not a bad thing imho). But anyways, otherwise it was OK experience.

item.name: ZÈRTZ
item.comment: Hmm. Initial rating. We ended the game in a way that was descibed as very very unprobable in the rules... Did we play something wrong? I have to figure it out. At least the rule set is confusing, as the rules itself should be very easy.

item.name: Zombie Dice
item.comment: I guess this can be fun with the right attitude and group. But the game itself is pretty nonexistent,
